titleStmt.title: James M. Shepard to James F. Robinson
CWG1487

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
George Town Ky. Jany 7th, 63
Govr James F Robinson
Dr. Sir

James Warring of this County says to Me that William Mefford stole from him a valuable Mare -- He wishes as a Means of Obtaining his property, it may be as a Citizen to have Mefford Arrested in Indiana and brought back to Kentucky -- Mefford it will be Seen was indicted at the last Term of the Scott Circuit Court -- The Indictment (a Copy) is enclosed -- He has requested me to State the facts -- and ask of you as Governor of Kentucky to make a Requisition on the Governor of Indiana for the arrest and delivery of Mefford to be tried under the Indictment.
I send the letter of the Marshall of Shelbyville Indiana Shewing that Mefford is there
